availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Judd (Owsley County farmer and infantry private)

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. North Carolina native. Married to Jane Venable Judd on July 2, 1865. Farmer in Owsley County in 1860. Private in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.).

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Boonville, p. 31. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jackson, Gray Hawk, Pond Creek Precinct 5, p. 11. Find A Grave, “Rev William C. Judd (March 17, 1841-June 7, 1905),” Memorial #30718436, http://findagrave.com/memorial/30718436 (accessed March 5, 2018). Mountain Advocate (Barbourville, Ky.), September 29, 1905. “Judd, William C.,” Soldiers and Sailors Database, National Park Service, https://www.nps.gov/civilwar/search-soldiers-detail.htm?soldierId=015BECAD-DC7A-DF11-BF36-B8AC6F5D926A (accessed January 19, 2017). KYR-0001-004-1337.
